SENT.plain: The pregnancy increases the risk of cardiovascular ischemic events, The longitudinal sinus thrombosis is very rare, but the incidence increases during pregnancy and puerperium
The mortality rates range from 25% to 50%
This report consists of a case which was studied and managed at the Military Central Hospital
It occurred on the 12th day post C-S
The diagnostic was confirmed by MRI
The treatment consisted of rest and heparin with a successful development
Our findings agreed with the studies reported at the literature that suggested a beneficial effect with the heparin's use, lowering drastically the mortality rates
Some still oppose to its use because of the risk of an intracranial hemorrhage
